properties.abstract: Vorder Glärnisch is for alpine hikers what Glärnisch is for climbers: an exciting tour to a fabulous viewpoint. The view down to Glarus from Vorder Glärnisch is even more impressive than from Vrenelisgärtli. The city of Glarus burnt down 150 years ago and was rebuilt as a planned city with a geometrical street layout, which, viewed from the summit, looks like a scale model. The ascent on the steep south face with its two huge gullies is more interesting than the usual white-blue marked route on the barren north face which has scree and rubble.
properties.subtitle: Vrenelis' little brother
properties.title: Traverse from Schwändi to Klöntalersee

sac_photos.title: Traversing Hanslirus: it is not as bad as it looks here.
Descending to Hintersackberg / Klöntal: steep, but the difficulties are manageable thanks to the well-designed alpine hiking trail.
The bifurcation on the descent via Schlattalpli

segments.description: From Schwändi follow the the yellow hiking trail briefly to P. 755, then go straight ahead on the small carriage road to P. 933. A red arrow shows the way up to the carefully kept small houses of Schwändisienen ("Schwander Siene" on the national map).
segments.title: Schwändi – Schwändisienen

segments.description: Past the houses (signpost) ascend in a gully and negotiate the subsequent step (faint path, T4). At 1600 m the terrain flattens. Traverse westward on scree under a rock wall until the «gelbe Wand» (yellow wall) at ca. 1720 m. Climb the wall from west to east in a gully. Continue on steep grassy slopes (faint path) until the lower right corner of the characteristic rock towers called Chilchli. The rock towers are overcome on a trail with sporadic markings (T4+) until a horizontal stretch of the ridge called «Gareplatz». On the left Garerus and on the right Hanslirus run steeply down the face. From here traverse the uppermost part of Hanslirus, at first slightly descending, on a delicate faint path (T5-).  You reach the south-west ridge of Vorder Glärnisch north-east of P. 2057 («Furggle»). Now on scree follow the ridge to the summit.
segments.title: Schwändisienen - Vorder Glärnisch

segments.description: The descent is on the white-blue-white marked alpine hiking trail at first on talus, then overcoming a first rocky escarpment to the Gleiter alp and another to Hintersackberg.
segments.title: Vorder Glärnisch - Hintersackberg

segments.description: Descend on the marked hiking trail, cutting short the bends of the road, to Rhodannenberg at the retaining wall of Klöntalersee.
segments.title: Hintersackberg - Rhodannenberg

segments.description: The ascent on the south face can also be undertaken via Mittler Guppen (from Schwanden on the mountain hiking trail) and by traversing Sienetobel via P. 1496. The itinerary merges with the other route at ca. 1650 m; T3, same hiking time.
segments.title: Variant: ascent via Mittler Guppen - Sienetobel

segments.description: Those who have some strength and time left can undertake the impressive traverse from Gleiter to Vorder Schlattalpli. From there descend to Rhodannenberg, T3.
segments.title: Descent via Schlattalpli
